chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Franklin L. Gray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI 5th, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payable monthly through probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

If recommended, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If recommended, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Comply with any programming and/or treatment agent recommends.

timeConds.notes: Sentence to start on or before December 28, 2015 at 6:00 pm.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Joint recommendation for 3 years probation.  1 year jail.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Fine, $600, plus costs.  DL rev 2 years & IID.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 3 years probation.    1 year jail, to commence on or before December 28, 2015 at 6 pm.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Fine, $600, plus costs.  Pay monthly through probation.   DL rev 2 years & IID.  Alc assm and dsp.   Submit DNA sample and surcharge.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Any treament or programming agent recommends.  AODA if recommended.

Defendant appears with SPD William Poss.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Poss requests a continuance - he has been in the process of trying to secure electronic monitoring but was unable to see Cpt. Ring or Sgt. Brown.  He has some issues the jail should be aware of before serving jail time.  Court states he pled over 2 months ago and needs to be disposed.  Reschedule to 12-14-15 at 1:30.  SPD Poss will talk to JASO regarding concerns.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  No other appearances.  Defendant unable to appear today.  Reschedule sentencing.

same appearances. Court advised the defendant of the penalties of the charge he plead to.  He understood.  Priors confirmed by the court.  Defendant plead no contest to count 1.  Count 2 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Elements reviewed by the court with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights with the defendant.  Felony warnings given.  Defendant understood.   Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the charge.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights. Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty of count 1.  Sentencing set for 10/26/2015 at 1:30 pm.  Bond continued.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Court reviewed waiver form with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Court finds that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to a preliminary hearing.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Resolved.  Set for plea/sentencing 9/21/15 at 10:30 am.  Will include WOPH at that time.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin. Report for booking

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing
